column2: Mission Become a cornerstone of our organization's success by safeguarding our facilities, personnel, assets, and reputation. You'll play a proactive, strategic role in risk mitigation, oversee physical and technical security, lead emergency preparedness initiatives, and ensure adherence to all relevant regulations and best practices. Key Responsibilities Strategic Security Planning & Risk Management (35%) Conduct comprehensive security risk assessments, analyzing potential threats from internal and external sources. Develop and execute risk-based security plans that align with the organization's business goals and risk tolerance. Lead threat intelligence efforts, staying ahead of evolving security trends and advising senior management on emerging risks. Establish and maintain a robust security awareness program for employees, educating them on identifying and reporting potential threats. Physical Security Operations (25%) Design and implement effective access control protocols, balancing security with operational efficiency. Oversee visitor management systems, ensuring thorough screening and adherence to company policies. Lead incident investigations with meticulous attention to detail, determining root causes and implementing corrective actions. Forge strong partnerships with local law enforcement, first responders, and other relevant external stakeholders. Technical Security & Safety (20%) Manage the selection, implementation, and maintenance of all security technology systems (CCTV, intrusion detection, access control, fire safety, etc.). Collaborate with IT and facilities teams to ensure seamless integration of security systems and robust cybersecurity practices. Develop and implement a proactive maintenance and upgrade plan for security technology, ensuring optimal performance and alignment with evolving threats. Emergency Preparedness, Response, & Business Continuity (20%) Create and maintain detailed emergency response plans for various scenarios (natural disasters, security breaches, medical emergencies, etc.). Conduct regular drills and exercises, evaluating team readiness and identifying areas for improvement. Develop business continuity plans in collaboration with department heads, minimizing disruption in the event of an incident. Team Leadership & Development Attract, retain, and develop a highly skilled security team. Set clear expectations, provide ongoing training, and foster a culture of excellence. Implement robust performance management processes, providing regular feedback and growth opportunities. Build strong morale and a sense of purpose within your team, promoting their success as a vital part of the overall organization. Compliance & Reporting Maintain meticulous documentation in line with regulatory requirements and industry standards. Conduct internal audits, ensuring compliance across facilities, operations, and technology systems. Prepare comprehensive reports for senior management, providing insightful updates on security metrics, incident trends, and risk mitigation efforts. Qualifications & Desired Skills Bachelor's degree in Criminal Justice, Security Management, or a related field. Advanced certifications are highly valued. 10+ years of progressive experience in corporate security, with a proven track record of leadership and strategic decision-making. Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to assess complex situations and develop effective solutions. Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills, enabling you to build trust with stakeholders across all levels of the organization. Proven success in project management, budget management, and vendor relationships.
